title: Helford River Walk Route

nearby.description: Falmouth to Swanpool and Maenporth Walk

images.title: Dr Duncan Pepper / Thatched Cottages
images.caption: Thatched Cottages. A quintessential English village view, thatched cottages nestling close to each other in Helford.

images.title: Ben Brooksbank [CC BY-SA 2.0   (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0 )], via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The east side of Helford harbour in 1969. Very little has changed after nearly 40 years

images.title: Jim Champion / Cottages by the creek, Helford
images.caption: Cottages by the creek, Helford. The cottages on the eastern side of the creek all have sensible names. For example, Creek Cottage or Larch Cottage (because there's a larch tree growing in the garden, visible here).

images.title: Row17 / St Anthony-in-Meneage from across the creek
images.caption: St Anthony-in-Meneage from across the creek

description: This circular walk follows a section of the South West Coast Path along the lovely Helford River in Cornwall. The popular estuary includes pretty creeks, old churches, nice beaches and lovely coastal views over Falmouth Bay. The walk starts at Helford Point where you can catch a ferry between Helford and Helford Passage. You head east, passing along the pretty harbour to Treath. You continue to Bosahan Cove and The Gew before coming to Dennis Head. There's lovely views over Falmouth Harbour from here. The route then turns west past Gillan Harbour where you will soon come to St Anthony-in-Meneage. The medieval parish church has a tower and font which dates from the 15th century. The route continues west to the small village of Manaccan where there is another interesting old church. The entrance dates from the Norman period while the rest of the structure is of the 13th and 15th centuries. The church is well known for its 250 year old fig-tree which is growing out of the western part of the south wall of the church. After leaving Manaccan the walk returns to Helford, passing through woodland on the way.
